contentrichtext.text: [[File:Zamboni ice resurfacer.jpg|thumb|200px|A Zamboni resurfacing the ice.]] "'''Zamboni'''" is a song written by Martin Zellar and recorded by his band [[Gear Daddies]]. The song tells the story of a man's desire to drive an [[ice resurfacer]], popularly known by the brand name "Zamboni", and his request to drive the Zamboni for his local [[ice hockey]] team. Since its release, it has sometimes been played between periods at hockey games while the [[Ice resurfacer|Zamboni]] cleans the ice. It originally appeared as a [[hidden track]] on the band's 1990 CD, ''[[Billy's Live Bait]]''. The song also appeared on the [[soundtrack]]s for the following [[The Walt Disney Company|Disney]] movies: * ''[[D2: The Mighty Ducks]]'' (1994) <ref>Sound Track at Amazon listed as "8. Zamboni - Gear Daddies" [http://www.amazon.com/Disneys-D2-Mighty-Motion-Picture/dp/B000000ODA Disney's D2: The Mighty Ducks - Songs From The Motion Picture SOUNDTRACK]</ref> * ''[[D3: The Mighty Ducks]]'' (1997) * ''[[Mystery, Alaska]]'' (1999) <ref>IMDB sound track listed 4th as "(I Wanna Drive the) Zamboni" [http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0134618/soundtrack Soundtracks for Mystery, Alaska (1999)]</ref> ==References== <references /> [[Category:History of ice hockey]] [[Category:Sporting songs]] [[Category:1990 songs]] {{1990s-song-stub}} {{icehockey-stub}}
